nodes.text: The Dilonexa system was a star system located in the Centrality, a sector of the Outer Rim Territories. It contained the planet Dilonexa XXIII.

The Dilonexa system was a star system located in the Centrality along the Falko Run, between the Ringneldia and Ua systems. It was comprised of forty planets that orbited a giant blue-white star. The only habitable planet was Dilonexa XXIII, with the inner twenty-two too hot to sustain life and the outer seventeen too cold.

The part of the galaxy containing the Dilonexa system was once controlled by the Sharu species's civilization, which was active from around 30,000 BBY until 25,200 BBY. The area was later explored by the Galactic Republic sometime between 3956 BBY and 3000 BBY. In 3350 BBY, the system's sector organized an independent government called the Centrality; however, the cluster of worlds was under the control of the Hutt kajidics. By 1004 BBY, the area had fallen under the influence of the Brotherhood of Darkness, although the faction was dissolved at the end of the New Sith Wars, in 1000 BBY.

After the Republic was reformed as the Galactic Empire in 19 BBY, the Centrality planets swore allegiance to the new regime, though the Hutts were largely in power during its reign. Once the New Republic took control of the galaxy in 6 ABY, the Centrality sector was again independent of galactic governments. By 137 ABY, the Dilonexa system was within the territory of Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire.

The Dilonexa system first appeared in Lando Calrissian and the Flamewind of Oseon, a 1983 book written by L. Neil Smith. It was later mentioned in Star Wars Gamer 5, released in 2001, which contained an eight-page article by Michael Kogge titled "A Campaign Guide to the Centrality". The system's position within the Centrality was depicted in 2009's The Essential Atlas written by Daniel Wallace and Jason Fry.
